clinical_study.brief_title: The Effect of Aronia With and Without Guarana Extract on Cognitive Function
clinical_study.official_title: The Effect of Acute and Short-term Aronia Melanocarpa and Combined Aronia Melanocarpa and Guarana Extract Supplementation on Cognitive Function in Healthy Young Adults

brief_summary.textblock: There is a great interest in improving cognitive performance, including memory and attention. Improved attention is desirable for a large group of people because it is linked to improved performance . Students and professionals can benefit from improved attention and thus performance in academic and other work environments. In addition, cognitive functioning also plays an important role in sports. Various cognitive skills, including attention, reaction time and motor function, have shown that they can influence sport performance. A completely natural supplement with aronia melanocarpa (and guarana) extract could be a promising way to naturally improve cognitive performance.

detailed_description.textblock: There is a great interest in improving cognitive performance, including memory and attention. Improved attention is desirable for a large group of people because it is linked to improved performance. Students and professionals can benefit from improved attention and thus performance in academic and other work environments. In addition, cognitive functioning also plays an important role in sports. Various cognitive skills, including attention, reaction time and motor function, have shown that they can influence sport performance. A completely natural supplement with aronia melanocarpa (and guarana) extract could be a promising way to naturally improve cognitive performance. The product in this study is aronia melanocarpa and a combination of aronia melanocarpa and guarana extract, both of which contain polyphenols. A limited number of clinical studies have already been carried out to see the effect of both products and simular products on cognitive functioning. However, these studies have often been done in older study populations, over a longer period of time and with one of the two (or simular) products. In this study, in healthy adolescents (ages between the 18-35 and with a BMI between 18.5 and 30), the investigators want to test the acute and short term (8 days) effect of aronia melanocarpa and the combination of guarana and aronia extract on cognitive functioning. The investigators will also test the effect of supplementation on the particpant's mood and the the Monoamine oxidase B level in the blood as well as the blood pressure. The study product is aronia malanocarpa and a combination of aronia malanocarpa extract and a guarana extract . Studies with the individual supplements (aronia malanocarpa and guarana) have shown positive indications with regard to cognitive functioning, but this has not been tested in healthy young adults and more importantly the combination of the two supplements has not yet been tested.

secondary_outcome.description: Systolic and diastolic will be measured
Systolic and diastolic will be measured

Visual analogue scale (VAS) will be used. Participants have to scale their emotions on a line. The mood states that will be addressed are afraid, confused, sad, angry, energetic, tired, happy, and tense. The score is determined by measuring the left side of the scale until the participant indicates their mood. This is measured with a ruler.

Visual analogue scale (VAS) will be used. Participants have to scale their emotions on a line. The mood states that will be addressed are afraid, confused, sad, angry, energetic, tired, happy, and tense. The score is determined by measuring the left side of the scale until the participant indicates their mood. This is measured with a ruler.
Monoamine oxidase beta levels will be measured in blood
Monoamine oxidase beta levels will be measured in blood

arm_group.description: combination of guarana and aronia melanocarpa supplementation

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Healthy young adults: ages between 18 and 35
- BM between 18.5-30 kg/m2
Exclusion Criteria:
- Regular caffeine usage
- Medicine usage that could influence the endpoint of the study
- Pregnancy or lactating
- Known allergies for berries
- High blood pressure (>140 systolic and/or >90 diastolic mmHg)
- Usage of more than 20 alcoholic consumptions a week
- Drug usage
- Supplement usage
- Participation in a scientific intervention study which may interfere with this study in the 180 days prior to this study
- Current usage of coumarin derivatives
